fields.summary: Android: Feature request to support picker in ListView

components.name: Alloy
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the Alloy here.

fields.description:
In a listView I declare this template
<ItemTemplate name="TimePicker" height="Titanium.UI.SIZE">
<Picker bindId="picker" width="Titanium.UI.FILL" type="Ti.UI.PICKER_TYPE_TIME"/>
</ItemTemplate>

I then run the app in the emulator it works fine but when I compile it for an iPhone 5s the app crashes as soon as I open the window containing the Picker.

From the console log this is the issue:
Class not found: Ti.UI.Picker


Workaround:
If in the controller i add
Ti.UI.createPicker();
the compiler includes the picker and the app works fine
fields.summary: A picker declared in a list template does not get included in the ios app
